Package com.example.trojan0project

Class EventsAdapterOrganizer

java.lang.Object
androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder>
com.example.trojan0project.EventsAdapterOrganizer
public class EventsAdapterOrganizer extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder>
Purpose: The `EventsAdapterOrganizer` class is a custom RecyclerView adapter designed for organizers to display and manage a list of events. It fetches event details from Firestore using event IDs and displays them in a RecyclerView. Each item can be clicked to navigate to the event's detailed view. Design Rationale: - Integrates with Firestore to dynamically fetch and display event details. - Uses a `RecyclerView` for efficient, scalable UI rendering. - Provides a user-friendly interface for event management, allowing organizers to view detailed information about each event by tapping on the item. Outstanding Issues: - No known issues at this time.

  • Method Details

    • onCreateViewHolder

      @NonNull public EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull android.view.ViewGroup parent, int viewType)
      Creates a new EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder for displaying an event item in the RecyclerView.

      This method inflates the layout for an event item and creates a new ViewHolder to manage the event view.

      Specified by:
      onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder>
      Parameters:
      parent - The ViewGroup into which the new view will be added.
      viewType - The view type of the new view (unused here).
      Returns:
      A new EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder instance for the event item view.

    • onBindViewHolder

      public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder holder, int position)
      Binds the event data to the EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder at the specified position in the RecyclerView.

      This method sets the event name (or ID if the name is unavailable) to the TextView and sets up a click listener on the item view to navigate to EventDetailsActivityOrganizer when clicked.

      Specified by:
      onBindViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder>
      Parameters:
      holder - The EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder that holds the views for the event item.
      position - The position of the item in the data set.

    • getItemCount

      public int getItemCount()
      Returns the total number of items in the data set.
      Specified by:
      getItemCount in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapterOrganizer.EventViewHolder>
      Returns:
